title: The Epstein Files and the Hidden World of an Unaccountable Elite
summary: The search continues in the documents for ironclad criminal conduct, but the story of a sexual predator given a free ride by the ruling class has already emerged.

title: Goldman Sachs General Counsel Kathryn Ruemmler Resigns Over Epstein Ties
summary: Kathryn Ruemmler, a former top Obama administration lawyer, is out at Goldman Sachs after emails showed a friendship with the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein spanning many years.

title: Conspiracy Theories Only Flourish With More Epstein Evidence
summary: The dump of millions of documents has fueled a new wave of speculation, A.I.-generated hoaxes and foreign disinformation.

title: How The Times Is Digging Into Millions of Pages of Epstein Files
summary: Two dozen journalists. A pile of pages that would reach the top of the Empire State Building. And an effort to find the next revelation in a sprawling case.

title: A Surge of Children in ICE Detention, and Meta’s Plans for Facial Recognition
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Iran Turns to Digital Surveillance Tools to Track Down Protesters
summary: As Iranian authorities restore some online services after crushing antigovernment demonstrations, they are using a technological dragnet to target attendees of the protests.

title: Beyond the Big Cities, ICE Is Rattling Small-Town and Exurban America
summary: Far from the national spotlight, towns like Cornelius, Ore., and Coon Rapids, Minn., are dealing with President Trump’s expanding mass deportation effort, and the effects can be acute.

title: ‘I Just Want to Get Out of Here’: ICE Is Detaining Hundreds of Children
summary: The number of children in immigration detention has spiked since last year. Families describe poor conditions and little education.

title: A D.H.S. Shutdown Looms. Bruised Minnesotans Urge Their Parties to Dig In.
summary: Congressional Democrats say they will approve no money for the Department of Homeland Security without guardrails on immigration agents. Their voters in Minnesota are demanding no less.

title: Restaurants Say ICE Presence Imperils Business
summary: In several cities where immigrants are being detained, owners say they’re struggling to stay open as fear keeps customers and workers from leaving home.

title: Trump Wants Smithsonian to Create a Different Official Portrait
summary: The painted portrait from President Trump’s first term was completed more than four years ago, but never unveiled. Now he wants the National Portrait Gallery to commission a new one.

title: What Does Romance Mean to You?
summary: Our podcast listeners share the everyday ways love shows up in their lives.

title: Meta Plans to Add Facial Recognition Technology to Its Smart Glasses
summary: In an internal memo last year, Meta said the political tumult in the United States would distract critics from the feature’s release.

title: The Transformative Power of the White ‘Race Traitor’
summary: From Schwerner and Goodman to Good and Pretti, white people putting themselves in harm’s way has helped galvanize Americans for justice.

title: Ukraine Says U.S. Is Increasing Pressure for a Deal as the Midterms Loom
summary: It is unclear what the Trump administration is prepared to do if it does not get the concessions it wants from Kyiv on issues like territory and elections.

title: These Ukrainian Drones Don’t Just Kill. They Deliver Oatmeal Cookies.
summary: In a war where drones are synonymous with destruction, some are also used to drop care packages to Ukraine’s frontline soldiers.

title: Amtrak’s Largest Train Revamp in 55 Years Is Coming Soon
summary: Step inside the sprawling factory in California where the largest fleet replacement in Amtrak’s 55-year history is coming together piece by piece.

title: Canada School Shooter’s Online Life Showed Interest in Violent Extremism
summary: The suspect in the British Columbia shooting had long been posting about mental health problems, substance abuse and a fascination with weapons and online violence.

title: What We Know About the Victims of the Tumbler Ridge Mass Shooting in Canada
summary: The attack at a secondary school and a private residence in the small, remote community in British Columbia has left families stunned and grief-stricken.

title: New Jersey Bridge Project Could Snarl Rail Traffic for a Month
summary: Construction on the new Portal North Bridge is expected to disrupt commutes into Manhattan on NJ Transit, PATH and Amtrak trains beginning on Sunday.

title: We’re All in a Throuple With A.I.
summary: What happens when the people building a new technology don’t want to use it?

title: The Infrastructure of Jeffrey Epstein’s Power
summary: The journalist Anand Giridharadas examines the power and influence that Jeffrey Epstein brokered, and which the latest batch of Epstein files puts on display.

title: At the Winter Olympics
summary: We look at what life is like on the ground in Milan and Cortina.

title: ‘The Daily Show’ Gives President Trump Yet Another Inaugural Award
summary: Jordan Klepper congratulated the president, the sole nominee for “the Inaugural Award for Winning the Most Inaugural Awards.”

title: UK Ban on Palestine Action Is Unlawful, Court Finds
summary: The High Court said the ban on Palestine Action as a terrorist group breached free speech rights and was disproportionate. The government said it would appeal, and the ban remained in place for now.

title: Greg Brown, Guitarist Who Wrote Cake’s Biggest Hit, Dies at 56
summary: His song “The Distance,” released in 1996, became an anthem for the disaffected members of Generation X.
